verbs.description: [ARG0: army] [V: sees] [ARG1: future of smaller smarter deadly drones troy the blackhawk helicopter scheduled to land at rensselaer polytechnic institute on tuesday to kick off the school new vertical aeronautics engineering school was grounded due to bad weather inside the u s army technology director] said the venerable aircraft which has been in service for some three decades will be making way for a future that belongs to small but deadly unmanned drones with artificial intelligence that can swarm targets without human intervention if necessary drones will be faster cheaper and lighter than the five - ton blackhawks which cost about 22 million apiece and even the next - generation helicopters now now being developed said jeff singleton a 34-year civilian engineer who is now technology director for the army the army is including so - called vertical lift aeronautics affiliated faculty office of naval research researcher rensselaer polytechnic institute united states army farhan gandhi engineer afghanistan iraq army national rotorcraft technology center vtol new york aviation and missile research development and engineering center terrafugia u s defense department united states army research laboratory u s director assault u s army research laboratory new york state energy research and development authority 10th mountain division israel ministry of defense boeing aviation applied technology directorate jeff singleton sikorsky u s army technology director fort drum

army sees future of [ARG0: smaller smarter deadly drones] [V: troy] the blackhawk helicopter scheduled to land at rensselaer polytechnic institute on tuesday to kick off the school new vertical aeronautics engineering school was grounded due to bad weather inside the u s army technology director said the venerable aircraft which has been in service for some three decades will be making way for a future that belongs to small but deadly unmanned drones with artificial intelligence that can swarm targets without human intervention if necessary drones will be faster cheaper and lighter than the five - ton blackhawks which cost about 22 million apiece and even the next - generation helicopters now now being developed said jeff singleton a 34-year civilian engineer who is now technology director for the army the army is including so - called vertical lift aeronautics affiliated faculty office of naval research researcher rensselaer polytechnic institute united states army farhan gandhi engineer afghanistan iraq army national rotorcraft technology center vtol new york aviation and missile research development and engineering center terrafugia u s defense department united states army research laboratory u s director assault u s army research laboratory new york state energy research and development authority 10th mountain division israel ministry of defense boeing aviation applied technology directorate jeff singleton sikorsky u s army technology director fort drum
